subject: Re: three hds? is this possible?
body:
-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

If you're going to hook up drives via usb, make sure you use
usb2.0. Transferring data to and from a drive using usb1.1 takes
forever.

Greg



On Wed, May 23, 2007 at 07:43:04PM -0400, Alex Snow wrote:
> Each IDE controler supports up to two devices.  Most machines have 2 
> controlers, which gives you 4 devices, which can be whatever you 
> want...cd-rom, hdd, etc.  Another option is to get external drives and 
> hook them up via USB or IEEE1394.
